page.title: 18Somerleyton as we see it
page.content: There are quite a few different things in the village. There is a school, the Ripplecraft Boat Company, a few farms, a public house, a manor house and a Lord and Lady Somerleyton. There is a man, Mr. Thacker, who has a collection of old tractors that he is selling. My dad bought one. Then, of course, there is my parent's business. They own and work in a petrol station and an oil business. The Post Office must be quite old for it has lattice windows. Outside is a post box and a telephone box. These are both red. The Post Office is a Savings Bank. It sells postcards, food and some clothes like gloves and legwarmers.
